meanings.definition: Causing someone to feel less important or proud
meanings.sent1: The humbling experience of failing a test can teach us valuable lessons.
meanings.sent2: It was a humbling moment when she realized she had made a mistake.
meanings.sent3: His humbling defeat in the game made him more determined to improve.
meanings.sent4: The humbling feedback from his boss made him reflect on his performance.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the vast ocean was a humbling reminder of nature's power.

meanings.definition: Making someone realize their own weaknesses or limitations
meanings.sent1: The coach's feedback was humbling, but it helped the player grow.
meanings.sent2: She found the experience of public speaking to be humbling.
meanings.sent3: His humbling defeat in chess made him practice harder for the next game.
meanings.sent4: The humbling realization of his mistake led him to seek forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The humbling challenge of climbing the mountain tested his endurance.

meanings.definition: Modest or meek in behavior or attitude
meanings.sent1: She spoke in a humbling tone, showing respect to her elders.
meanings.sent2: His humbling demeanor made him approachable and likable.
meanings.sent3: The humbling way he accepted praise without boasting was admirable.
meanings.sent4: Her humbling presence in the room made everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The humbling act of helping others without seeking recognition is truly noble.
